data.title: NOYER (Christian)
data.meta_description: Interview with Christian Noyer, Vice-President of the European Central Bank from 1998 to 2002 and Governor of the Banque de France since 2003, carried out by the Centre Virtuel de la Connaissance sur l’Europe (CVCE) on 27 September 2012 at the premises of the Banque de France in Paris. Conducted by François Lafond, Managing Director of EuropaNova, the interview particularly focuses on the following aspects of the life of Tommaso Padoa-Schioppa: his personality, his activities on the ECB Executive Board (1998–2005) and his work as Minister for the Economy and Finance (2006–2008).
data.text:
Born on 6 October 1950 in Soisy-sous-Montmorency (F)

Nationality: French

Senior official in the Treasury Department of the French Ministry of the Economy and Finance (1976–1980)

Senior official in the French Permanent Representation to the European Communities (1980–1982)

Bureau Chief for regulations and relations between the Finance Ministry and the banking profession (1982–1986)

Adviser in the Private Office of Finance Minister Édouard Balladur (1986–1988)

Director of the Private Office of Finance Minister Edmond Alphandéry (1993)
